Description.Html: Interpreters convert the spoken word from one language into another, either face-to-face or remotely.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join an industry association to help with your professional development and to build up your network of contacts. Organisations include:Institute of Translation and Interpreting; International Association of Conference Interpreters; Chartered Institute of Linguists; National Register of Public Service Interpreters

HtbCareerTips.Html:
To be fluent, you should:

  • be able to communicate quickly, smoothly and accurately
  • know and understand informal speech, slang and regional differences
  • understand the culture of the country or countries where the language is spoken

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training and working as an interpreter from the Institute of Translation and Interpreting.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could combine interpreting with translating or teaching. You could also move into the management of interpreting services in the public and private sector.

Description.Html: Investment analysts help stock market traders, stockbrokers and fund managers make decisions about investments.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join organisations like the CFA Institute and Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You may find it useful to have knowledge of a specific industry for some jobs, for example experience in areas like energy, engineering or life sciences could be helpful.

Language skills, particularly French, German or Japanese, can also be useful if you're working with overseas clients and markets.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an investment analyst from:Finance Conduct Authority; CFA Institute; Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a good track record, you could become a stockbroker and progress to account manager or fund manager.

You could also become a freelance investment consultant.

Description.Html: IT project managers oversee the development and installation of computer hardware and software systems.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in computing from The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience, you could become a senior project manager or move into more specialised roles like cyber security.

You could go into departmental or operations management.

You could also become a teacher, trainer, assessor or freelance consultant.

Description.Html: IT security co-ordinators protect their clients' data from unauthorised access, theft and misuse.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Chartered Institute of Information Security for professional development opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in IT and digital security from The Chartered Institute for IT and National Cyber Security Centre.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move into network management, IT project management or security consultancy.

You could work for the police, security services or specialist law firms, carrying out forensic investigation of computer-based crimes.

Description.Html: IT service engineers install and repair computer systems and equipment.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may also find it useful to get an industry standard certification like:CompTia A+; Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in computing from Tech Future Careers and The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a service supervisor.

With further training and qualifications, you could also move into network engineering, IT security, database administration, project management, training or technical sales.

Another option is to set up your own company, providing a service to local businesses and consumers.

You can keep up to date with industry developments through professional development training with organisations like The Chartered Institute for IT.

Description.Html: IT technical support staff diagnose and solve software and hardware problems for computer users.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in IT support from Tech Future Careers and The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory or management role. You could also apply for roles in training or technical sales.

With training, you could move into:

  • network engineering
  • database administration
  • business or systems analysis
  • IT security
  • IT project management

Description.Html: IT trainers design and teach computer courses.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may be helpful if you get the European Computer Driving Licence qualification. This teaches you the main computing skills for everyday work tasks.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a lead trainer, department manager, area training co-ordinator or a freelance trainer or consultant.

You could also move into technical writing, project management or work in other areas of IT, like e-learning development or publishing.

Description.Html: Jewellery designers plan and create jewellery, silverware and other decorative products.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Jewellery design is very competitive and not all vacancies are advertised. You may find it useful to make contacts within the industry to help find work. You could do this by going to trade fairs and exhibitions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become self-employed and sell your designs to manufacturers. Or, you could make up the designs and sell them yourself through galleries, in shops and online.

Description.Html: Judges hear evidence in criminal and civil courts, make rulings and pass sentences based on the information presented during cases.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
If you are appointed as a full-time judge, you will not be able to return to legal practice.

Part-time judges, usually found in the lower courts, for example a tribunal or district judge, are paid a fee for each court session and are expected to sit for at least 15 sessions a year. Fee-paid judges can continue to practise law, providing there is no conflict of interest.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a judge from:Courts and Tribunals Judiciary; Judicial Appointments Commission; The Law Society

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
There are structured career development routes in the judiciary, which allow you to move from fee-paid sessional roles in the lower courts through to paid positions in the upper courts.

For example, with experience, you might move from deputy district judge or recorder to become a permanent district judge, circuit judge or high court judge. Beyond that, you could be appointed to the court of appeal.

You can also specialise in particular divisions of the judiciary, like the family courts or employment tribunals.

Description.Html: Kennel workers care for dogs and cats in kennels or catteries.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Kennel work is very practical and experience of working with animals, paid or unpaid, could improve your job prospects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in animal care from the National Land Based College UK and the The College of Animal Welfare.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager, or set up your own kennels or cattery.

You could move into other kinds of work with animals, like dog trainer, RSPCA inspector or veterinary nurse.

Description.Html: Kitchen and bathroom fitters install kitchens and bathroom suites in homes and businesses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on careers in kitchen and bathroom fitting from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could find work with building companies, design agencies, kitchen and bathroom manufacturers and retailers. You could also set up your own business.

With further training, like in computer aided design (CAD), you could move into planning and installation design.

In a larger company, you could progress to become a business development manager, area sales coordinator, or project manager leading a team of designers and installers.

Description.Html: Kitchen assistants prepare food, make sure chefs have everything they need and keep the kitchen clean.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about catering careers from the Hospitality Guild and CareerScope.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could become a trainee or junior chef.

You could also progress into management or move into bar work or food service.

Description.Html: Kitchen porters clean, wash up and prepare food to keep hotel, restaurant and hospital kitchens running smoothly.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a kitchen porter from the Hospitality Guild and CareerScope.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and training you could progress to kitchen assistant or chef.

Description.Html: Knitters produce garments, soft furnishings and accessories by hand and on knitting machines.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more information on working in crafts and creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a production supervisor, move into quality control or set up your own small business.

You could also become a knitwear designer for a textiles company by completing a higher education qualification in fashion.

Description.Html: Laboratory technicians support scientists and help carry out tests, research and investigations.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join a professional body relevent to your area of work for career development and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Experience in a lab can help when looking for work. You can get this by:

  • doing a year in industry as part of your degree
  • applying for part-time work in a laboratory whilst studying

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a laboratory technician from the Science Council and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to team manager or lab supervisor, or specialise in complex analysis work.

With a degree and experience you could move into a research technician role.

TitlePart.Title: Land and property valuer and auctioneer

Description.Html: Valuers and auctioneers advise individuals and businesses that buy, sell and rent land and property.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a land and property valuer and auctioneer from the Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a project manager, company partner or work as a freelance consultant.

data.DisplayText: Land and property valuer and auctioneer
data.Author: admin

Description.Html: Land surveyors measure the shape of the land, and gather data for civil engineering and construction projects.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a land surveyor from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors and The Survey Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into project management or contract management. You could specialise in an aspect of surveying, or work as a self-employed consultant.

Applying for chartered status through RICScould improve your career prospects.

You may also be able to apply for chartered environmentalist status. You can find out more about being a chartered environmentalist from the Society for the Environment.

Description.Html: Landscape architects plan, design, create and manage the landscapes we live and work in.

HtbBodies.Html: You could become a member of the Landscape Institute to increase your professional standing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find out more about how to train as a landscape architect from the Landscape Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move on to a supervisory or management position, become a partner in a private practice, or set up your own practice.

You could also take a teaching qualification and become a lecturer in landscape architecture at a university.

Description.Html: Landscapers create and maintain gardens, parks and other outdoor and indoor areas.

HtbBodies.Html: You can apply for membership of the British Association of Landscape Industries for advice, training support and details of job vacancies.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a landcaper from:The Royal Horticultural Society; GoLandscape; Grow Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In larger firms, you could progress to a supervisory or management position. With experience, you could become a self-employed contractor.

You could also move into a teaching role.

Description.Html: Large goods vehicle (LGV) and heavy goods vehicle (HGV) lorry drivers transport and deliver goods between suppliers and customers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find details about large goods vehicle licence applications on GOV.UK.

You can find out more about driver training and the licences you need from the Freight Transport Association and the Road Haulage Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could take further training and gain an ADR (Advisory Dangerous Goods by Road) Certificate to drive hazardous goods like toxic chemicals by tanker.

With experience, you could train to become an LGV instructor, freight transport planner or move into management.

Description.Html: Laundry workers operate washing machines and tumble dryers to clean and dry items like clothes, bed linen and uniforms.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Guild of Cleaners and Launderers for professional development training and the latest industry information.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in laundry services through the Guild of Cleaners and Launderers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could progress to supervisor or manager.

You could also start your own laundry business.

Description.Html: Learning disability nurses help people with a learning disability to live as independently as possible.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's possible to do a degree in learning disabilities nursing and social work. You'll need to check that the course is recognised by the relevant professional bodies. Course providers can advise you on this.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a learning disability nurse from the Nursing & Midwifery Council and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With further study and experience you could become an advanced nurse practitioner (ANP), clinical nurse specialist (CNS) or nurse consultant. Consultants work directly and independently with patients, carry out research and develop and deliver training.

You could lead a team of nurses in a residential setting or manage a learning disability unit. You could also move into other management roles, like community matron or director of nursing.

You could also go on to train as a health visitor.

Description.Html: Learning mentors help students and pupils deal with any difficulties they have with their learning.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in learning support from FE Advice.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in working with particular groups, like excluded students.

You could also move into more senior mentoring roles, with supervisory or co-ordinating duties.

With further training, you might work in student advice and guidance, teaching, speech and language therapy, educational welfare or social work.

Description.Html: Leather craftworkers make clothes, shoes and accessories from leather, using traditional methods.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about working in the leather industry from The Leathersellers' Company.

You can get more information on working in craft and creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a supervisor or specialise in an area like leather pattern design, sales or marketing.

You could also set up your own business or move into the leather manufacturing and finishing industry.

Description.Html: Leather technologists prepare, treat and finish leather to make it ready for manufacturing.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Society of Leather Technologists and Chemists for technical advice, networking opportunities and professional development training.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in the leather technology industry from Eurofins BLC Leather Technology Centre.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into related jobs like production manager, company chemist, buyer or technical salesperson.

You could move into other jobs in quality control, research or technical management. You could also move into related areas such as buying, sales or marketing.

You could set up your own research or consultancy business and work freelance for retail firms and leather companies.

Description.Html: Legal executives specialise in one area of law and carry out similar tasks to solicitors.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about a legal executive career from the Chartered Institute of Legal Executives.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could take on more complex cases and build up a large client base. You could also progress to leading a team of legal executives and secretaries, or become a practice manager in a law firm.

With further study, you could qualify as a solicitor.

Description.Html: Legal secretaries provide administrative support for lawyers and legal executives.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about legal secretary careers from The Institute of Legal Secretaries and PAs.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a senior secretary, PA or office manager in larger firms.

With further qualifications, you could become a legal executive, paralegal or licensed conveyancer.

You could also work towards training as a solicitor or barrister.

Description.Html: Leisure centre assistants help and supervise visitors using leisure centre facilities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some employers may prefer you to have a qualification in first aid, gym instruction or lifeguarding.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and further qualifications, you could become a supervisor or manager. You could also move into fitness instructing, lifeguarding or sports coaching.

Description.Html: Leisure centre managers look after the day-to-day running of sports and leisure centres.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join the Chartered Institute for the Management of Sport and Physical Activity for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in leisure from the Chartered Institute for the Management of Sport and Physical Activity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You're likely to have more opportunities for promotion in larger organisations. With experience you may be able to become an area or regional manager, with responsibility for service development among a group of centres.

You could use your experience in leisure centre management to move into related areas like sports promotion and development, or building partnerships with local authorities and national governing bodies.

Description.Html: Letting agents manage rental properties on behalf of owners.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join ARLA Propertymark and Chartered Institute of Housing for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in property letting from ARLA Propertymark and Chartered Institute of Housing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to a management role, or move into estate agency work.

Description.Html: Librarians run public and private libraries, managing access to books, multi-media resources and computers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a librarian from the Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into a senior job as a manager. Another option is to take responsibility for a specialist service or collection.

If you hold a senior position in your organisation, you could apply for professional registration of the Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals (CILIP).

Description.Html: Library assistants help librarians to manage the day-to-day running of a library.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A knowledge of information classification systems, like the Dewey Decimal Classification, may be useful, though not essential, as training would be given.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in libraries from the Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and qualifications, you could become a librarian. The Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals (CILIP) has more information.

Description.Html: Conveyancers are property lawyers who deal with the paperwork and finances needed to buy and sell property or land in England and Wales.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more details about careers in conveyancing from the Council for Licensed Conveyancers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a conveyancing department in a large company, or set up your own conveyancing firm.

You could also take further training to become a solicitor.

Description.Html: Life coaches support and encourage people to help them make informed decisions in their working and personal lives.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful if you have experience in psychology, management, counselling or teaching.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice on coaching and mentoring from the Coaching and Mentoring Network and the Life Coach Directory.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could set up your own business and employ other coaches.

Description.Html: Lifeguards look after swimming areas, help swimmers to stay safe and carry out rescues in emergencies.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful to have a first aid qualification when applying for jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training to be a pool or beach lifeguard from:Careers in Aquatics; Royal Life Saving Society UK; Swimming Teachers' Association; Surf Life Saving GB

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a leisure centre manager with the National Pool Management Qualification.

Some pool lifeguards get swimming teaching or coaching qualifications and give swimming lessons. You could also train and lead a team of lifeguards.

You could compete in lifeguarding competitions.

Description.Html: Lift engineers install, service and repair lifts and escalators.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more on careers in maintenance engineering from the Lift and Escalator Industry Association and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into supervisory management, technical sales or general engineering.

You could also use your skills to move into other industries, like manufacturing, engineering construction or safety inspection, either employed by a company or as a freelance contractor.

Description.Html: Lighting technicians set up and operate lighting for concerts, conferences and theatre, or in film and TV productions.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's a good idea to build up a portfolio of your work. This could be a showreel DVD or online profile of productions you've worked on, which you can show to potential employers.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in production lighting from ScreenSkills.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could work on more complex events, or specialise in areas like electrical safety, inspection and testing, pyrotechnics or rigging.

Description.Html: Live sound engineers control the sound at events like theatre performances, music concerts and festivals.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Institute of Sound and Communications Engineers for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a live sound engineer from Spotlight.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to chief sound engineer in a theatre, become a sound designer, or set up your own sound services company.

Description.Html: Local government administrative assistants provide clerical support in council departments and give information to the public.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: The Local Government Association has a guide on what it's like to work for a local authority and the different careers that are available.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to office manager, or jobs with more responsibility in other departments.

You could also move into administrative work in other sectors.

Description.Html: Local government officers put council policies into practice and deliver local services.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may be able to get into this job through an internship.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about working in local government through the Local Government Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress into management.

You could also move into other public sector areas like the NHS or the voluntary sector.

Description.Html: Revenues and benefits officers work for local councils and deal with housing benefits, rents, council tax and business rates.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in local government finance through the Local Government Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and qualifications you could progress into more senior roles, including fraud investigations or property valuation.

Description.Html: Locksmiths install, repair and maintain locks for homes and businesses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in locksmithing from the Master Locksmiths Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could work for a national company, run a franchise or become self-employed.

Description.Html: Magazine journalists research and write news articles and features for a wide variety of publications.

HtbBodies.Html: As a journalism student you can apply for student membership of the National Union of Journalists (NUJ). The NUJ also has information on bursaries that may be available.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in publishing from the Professional Publishers Association and the National Union of Journalists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you may be able to progress to an editing position or move into another area like newspaper journalism, radio or TV.

You could go freelance and write for various publications, or become a staff writer.

Description.Html: Magistrates are volunteers who hear cases in court. They pass judgements and hand down short sentences, fines and other penalties.

HtbCareerTips.Html: As a volunteer magistrate, you'll be expected to work at least 13 full days in a year, or 26 half days. You will not be paid as a magistrate but you can claim an allowance for expenses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a magistrate from the:Magistrates Association; Courts and Tribunals Judiciary; GOV.UK

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could act as the chairperson or presiding magistrate on a panel of 3 magistrates in court.

You could also specialise in particular courts like the family court, or the youth court, dealing with young people aged between 10 and 17. You could volunteer to mentor new magistrates or apply to sit with judges on panels hearing appeals.

You could also use your experience to join committees advising policy makers on judicial issues, for example prison standards or sentencing guidelines.

Description.Html: Maintenance fitters install, service and repair industrial machinery and equipment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about careers in engineering from the ECITB and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could do further training while you work, to become an engineering technician or site supervisor. Relevant courses include:

  • Level 3 (NVQ) Diploma in Engineering Maintenance
  • Level 3 Diploma in Installing Engineering Construction Plant and Systems - Mechanical Fitting
  • Level 3 Combined Diploma in Process Engineering Maintenance

Description.Html: Make-up artists apply make-up and style hair for people appearing on camera or in front of a live audience.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the National Association of Screen Make-up and Hair for professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
It's a good idea to get practical experience to put together a portfolio of work to show employers. You can get this through:

  • amateur theatre
  • student film, theatre and photography projects
  • charity or student fashion shows
  • working with established make-up artists and photographers
  • working in related areas such as department store cosmetics counters, wedding and events make-up

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about careers in make-up on stage and screen from ScreenSkills.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Many make-up artists work freelance and develop their career by building a network of contacts and getting recommendations from their clients.

With experience, you could progress to chief make-up artist or make-up designer. You could also develop specialist skills, for example applying body art or making facial or body moulds for creating and fitting prosthetics.

You could move into areas like fashion and photography, print and digital media or special effects.

You might also specialise in medical aesthetics, using make-up techniques to hide scars and skin conditions to improve a client's psychological wellbeing and confidence.

Description.Html: Management accountants look after a company's finances and find ways to improve profitability.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working in a finance role will help you to get into this career. Many large accountancy firms run insight days and offer shadowing opportunities, where you can see how the industry works.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in accountancy from the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior manager or finance director, or the chief executive of a company. You could also become a self-employed management consultant.

You could offer accountancy services in private practice if you register with CIMA.

Description.Html: Management consultants help organisations solve problems and improve efficiency.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it helps to become a member of a professional body like the Institute of Consulting.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Foreign language skills are highly valued, as many firms work with international clients.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in management consultancy from the Management Consultancies Association and the Chartered Management Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a partner in a management consultancy, work freelance or set up your own consultancy firm.

You could become a member of the Institute of Consulting and apply for certified management consultant status.

Description.Html: Manufacturing supervisors keep production lines running smoothly and manage staff.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into quality control, production planning and management or research and development.

Description.Html: Manufacturing systems engineers design and install manufacturing equipment and assembly production lines.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers in systems engineering from the Institution of Mechanical Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could find work in any branch of manufacturing, like automotive, food and drink, pharmaceuticals or electronics.

You could work towards incorporated or chartered engineer status.

As an incorporated engineer, you would specialise in the day-to-day management of engineering operations. At chartered level, you would have a more strategic role, planning, researching and developing new ideas and streamlining management methods.

Description.Html: Marine engineers design, build, test and repair boats, ships, underwater craft, offshore platforms and drilling equipment.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers in engineering from the Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology and British Marine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in project management, research and development or consultancy.

There are also opportunities for experienced marine engineers to work in shore-based roles with responsibility for vessel refits, legal work in maritime engineering safety and shipping fleet management.

Description.Html: Marine engineering technicians design, build, service and repair boats and ships.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers in marine engineering from the Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology and British Marine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a supervisory role or engineering project management work.

You could specialise in a particular area, like boat design, specialist equipment sales and support or marine insurance.

Description.Html: Market research data analysts study statistics and information collected through surveys.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal Statistical Society and The Market Research Society, for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Knowledge of social media analytics will be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in market research from:The Market Research Society; Royal Statistical Society; Social Research Association

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress into management, or become a self-employed market research consultant.

Description.Html: Market research executives help clients find out about people's views on consumer products or political and social issues.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Being able to speak different languages could be an advantage for international work.

Whatever your qualifications, you’ll find it useful to have experience in marketing, sales or advertising, or as a market research interviewer.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about market research careers from The Market Research Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into management, or become a self-employed market research consultant.

You could also work in advertising or marketing promotions.

Description.Html: Market researchers interview people to find out what they think about products, services or issues.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in sales or marketing could help you get into this career.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working in market research through The Market Research Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or area fieldwork manager. You could also become a research assistant in a market research agency or social research organisation.

Description.Html: Market traders sell goods like food or clothing, or services like mobile phone repairs, from market or street stalls.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the National Market Traders Federation for advice and training to support your business.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Do your research on what sells well. You may have an advantage if you're offering something different from other traders.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about becoming a market trader and setting up your business through the National Market Traders Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could expand your business by taking on staff and starting up new stalls.

You could also move into market management.

Description.Html: Marketing directors plan ways to promote products or brands and increase their company's share of the market.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the The Chartered Institute of Marketing and the Institute of Data and Marketing for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: An excellent understanding of social media will be vital for most jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in marketing from The Chartered Institute of Marketing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move to a bigger company or work as a marketing consultant, advising corporate clients how to develop their brands.

Description.Html: Marketing executives promote a company's products, services or brand.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join The Chartered Institute of Marketing and the The Institute of Data and Marketing to do professional qualifications and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a marketing executive from The Chartered Institute of Marketing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a marketing manager.

You can use the skills you develop as a marketing executive to move into digital marketing, if you're interested in that career.

You could also become a freelance marketing consultant, or work in advertising, sales or public relations and communications.

Description.Html: Marketing managers plan how to promote products, services or brands and oversee all marketing activity.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join The Chartered Institute of Marketing for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about marketing careers from The Chartered Institute of Marketing and the The Institute of Data and Marketing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a regional manager or marketing director. You could also become a brand or account director.

Another option is to work as a freelance marketing consultant.

Description.Html: Martial arts instructors teach martial arts like karate, jujitsu and judo.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may need a children's instructor award before working with children. It can also help you if you have experience of teaching or coaching another sport, and a first aid certificate.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a martial arts instructor from UK Coaching.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, and a senior instructor award, you could set up your own school or association.

Description.Html: Massage therapists manipulate clients' muscles and soft tissues, treat sports injuries, and give relief to people with health issues.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the voluntary register of the Complementary and Natural Healthcare Council or the Federation of Holistic Therapists.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can specialise in a particular form of massage like baby and infant massage, or sports massage. You'll need to take extra training to do this.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could build up and maintain a reputation and client base, and set up your own business.

You could also train in other complementary therapies like aromatherapy, reiki or reflexology.

Description.Html: Materials engineers research the behaviour of materials used in industry to make them stronger, lighter and more hard-wearing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in materials engineering from the Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into project management or technical sales. You could also specialise in a particular material, or work in research and consultancy.

Description.Html: Materials technicians test the behaviour of materials under different conditions to help develop new products and improve existing ones.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in materials engineering from the Institute of Materials, Minerals and Mining.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a senior technician and register with the Engineering Council to get EngTech status. With further training, you could qualify as a materials engineer.

You could also move into purchasing, sales and management.

Description.Html: Maternity support workers help midwives provide care to women and their babies, before, during and after childbirth.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a maternity support worker from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a senior support worker, or train as a midwife or adult nurse.

Description.Html: Meat hygiene inspectors make sure processing plants and slaughterhouses follow safety and hygiene standards during food production.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to become a manager in food retail or manufacturing, or a supervisor or manager in the Food Standards Agency.

Description.Html: Meat process workers produce meat products for the food manufacturing, catering and food retail industries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in food production from the Food and Drink Training and Education Council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a shift supervisor or manager on the production line, or in an area like quality control, product development or food marketing.

With further experience you could train to become a meat hygiene inspector.

Description.Html: Mechanical engineers develop and design the components and machinery used in manufacturing, construction and other industries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become an engineer through the Institution of Mechanical Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for local and central government, the armed services, manufacturers in all industries, research and development facilities and public utilities.

With incorporated or chartered engineer status you could move into project management roles, specialise in a particular field, work in research or become an engineering consultant.

Description.Html: Mechanical engineering technicians design, install and repair industrial plant machinery and parts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details about careers and training through the Institution of Mechanical Engineers and Tomorrow's Engineers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a supervisor or project manager, or specialise in areas like CAD design or quality control.

You could also qualify as an engineer by completing a degree in mechanical engineering.

Description.Html: Media researchers support producers by finding information, people and places for television or radio programmes.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You'll need to get practical experience of media production, and to develop a network of contacts in the industry.

For general areas, knowledge of current affairs and the media, plus evidence of lateral thinking and creative problem solving is useful.

Specialist knowledge and research experience may be needed for specific subjects or documentaries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a media researcher from ScreenSkills and organisations like:BBC Careers; Channel 4; ITV

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could supervise a research team on larger productions.

You could also move into an assistant producer role, or writing or directing.

Description.Html: Medical herbalists use plants and herbal remedies to help improve their clients' health and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html:
There is currently no statutory regulation for medical herbalists.

Check with the National Institute of Medical Herbalists and European Herbal and Traditional Medicine Practitioners Association for the latest information about regulation.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a medical herbalist from the National Institute of Medical Herbalists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into teaching or research.

Description.Html: Medical illustrators produce photographs, videos and graphical images for use in healthcare.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Academy for Healthcare Science or Institute of Medical Illustrators for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Medical illustration is a small and specialised field, and there's a lot of competition for vacancies. You'll improve your job prospects if you also have relevant work experience.

Some courses include work placements, or you could contact your local university or NHS trust's medical photography department to arrange a visit or some work shadowing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice on careers and training in medical illustration through the Institute of Medical Illustrators and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to a management role. With further study, you could also move into research or teaching.

Description.Html: Medical physicists are specialists in healthcare science, also known as clinical science.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in medical physics through Health Careers and the Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could go on to lead a department, work in higher education, research, or in the medical equipment manufacturing industry.

Description.Html: Medical sales representatives work for pharmaceutical companies, selling drugs, medicines and medical equipment to health professionals.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in medical sales from the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and a good track record in sales, you could progress into area or regional management, or into marketing, product or account management.

Description.Html: Medical secretaries provide office support in hospitals, GP surgeries, private clinics and universities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about medical secretarial careers from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a team of secretaries in a large organisation.

With further training, you could become an administration manager, office manager or GP practice manager.

You could also move into roles in finance or HR.

Description.Html: Mental health nurses work in hospitals and the community, to support people with mental health issues.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's possible to do a degree in mental health nursing and social work. You'll need to check that the course is recognised by the relevant professional bodies. Course providers can advise you on this.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about working and training in nursing from the Royal College of Nursing and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a sister or ward manager and be responsible for running a ward or team of nurses in the community. You could go on to become matron or director of nursing.

With further study and experience, you could become an advanced nurse practitioner (ANP), clinical nurse specialist (CNS) or nurse consultant. Consultants work directly and independently with patients, carry out research and develop and give training.

You could also train in health visiting, become self-employed or work overseas.

Description.Html: Merchant Navy deck officers look after the day-to-day running and navigation of ships, and take care of passengers and cargo.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a Merchant Navy deck officer from Careers at Sea and the Royal Fleet Auxilliary.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
The Merchant Navy has clear progression routes through its ranks

You could find onshore and offshore positions with shipping companies, port authorities, maritime insurance companies and shipping brokers. Roles include logistics and fleet coordination, training and general management.

You could work for UK companies or for shipping companies based overseas.

You could also become a manager in other sectors.

Description.Html: Merchant Navy engineering officers maintain the mechanical and electrical machinery and instruments on board a ship.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a Merchant Navy engineering officer from Careers At Sea and Merchant Navy Training Board.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work your way up to third, second and then senior engineer before taking on the role of chief engineer. You could also work towards chartered status with the Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology (IMarEST).

If you decide to work onshore you could move into management, ship surveying, lecturing or research.

Description.Html: Merchant Navy ratings carry out a wide range of jobs to help the day-to-day running of a ship.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a Merchant Navy rating from Careers at Sea.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to the ranks of leading hand, petty officer and chief petty officer. With the necessary skills and experience, you could take further training to join the junior officer ranks.

You could also use your skills to move into onshore engineering or a hospitality and catering career.

Description.Html: Meteorologists collect and study data from the atmosphere and oceans to make weather forecasts and carry out research.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can do a short work placement to find out more about meteorology as a career, if you're aged between 14 and 17.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can learn more about becoming a meteorologist from the Met Office and the Royal Meteorological Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could manage a team of weather forecasters. You could also move into teaching and train future forecasters and scientists.

Description.Html: Metrologists use very precise measurements in science and industry to make sure that processes and products meet high standards.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Measurement and Control for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Measurement science is an important part of every day life. Visit the BIPM, the international organisation that governs weights and measures, to find out more.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about metrology and how it's used from the Institute of Measurement and Control and the National Physical Laboratory.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can use your skills to work in many different industries, from environment, energy and aerospace to transport, construction and healthcare.

With experience, you can move into a team management role, specialise in a particular area of measurement, or work in science and research.

Description.Html: Microbiologists study micro-organisms like bacteria, viruses, fungi and algae.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in microbiology from the Microbiology Society and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could move into lab management, research or teaching.

In the NHS you could progress to specialist, team manager and consultant.

You could also offer consultancy services in areas like pharmaceutical sales, publishing and law.

Description.Html: Microbrewers produce and market their own alcoholic drinks like beers, ciders and gins.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Society of Independent Brewers for training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the brewing industry from the Society of Independent Brewers and Brewlab.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could increase production volume and become a bigger brewery, or work for a larger brewery company as a master brewer. You could also become a consultant, giving advice to others on setting up in the craft drinks trade.

You could run brewing or distilling workshops for people new to microbrewing or for hobbyists.

Description.Html: Midwives support pregnant women and their babies before, during and after, childbirth.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Previous paid or unpaid experience of working in a caring role would be useful. You could contact the voluntary services co-ordinator or manager at your local NHS trust for further advice about opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more on how to become a midwife from the Royal College of Midwives and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You must renew your Nursing & Midwifery Council registration every 3 years to show you're keeping your skills up to date.

You could take further training to specialise in areas like ultrasound or neonatal care.

With experience, you could become a ward manager or team leader.

You could also train to become a health visitor, a director of midwifery or midwifery consultant.

Description.Html: Model makers design and create 3D models for TV and film, and for use in engineering, construction and architecture.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
Find more advice about working in model making in the creative industries through ScreenSkills.

You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could lead a team of model makers in construction, engineering, film or TV.

As a self-employed model maker you could become an agent for other model makers.

Description.Html: Money advisers help people whose debts have become too large or difficult for them to handle.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the Institute of Money Advisers, for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: For some jobs, it may be an advantage if you speak a minority community language.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a specialist caseworker, or be promoted to a team leader or management post.

Description.Html: Montessori teachers help very young children to grow in confidence, and learn at their own pace.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Many people start Montessori training after working in other careers, not related to working with children or in education.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a Montessori teacher from the Maria Montessori Institute and Montessori Society AMI UK.

You can explore different types of courses and ways to train through the Montessori Group.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you're a teacher or early years practitioner in a state school, you could use Montessori methods to broaden your professional practice.

With experience, you could become a nursery manager, assistant headteacher or headteacher. You could also become an area manager for a group of schools or train other Montessori teachers.

You may be able to set up your own school, or take on a franchise either in the UK or overseas.

Description.Html: Mortgage advisers help people find, and apply for mortgages.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the The London Institute of Banking and Finance, the Chartered Insurance Institute and the Chartered Banker Institute, for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in the finance industry through The London Institute of Banking and Finance and the Chartered Banker Institute.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a team of mortgage advisers, or you could choose to become a self-employed independent adviser.

You could also take further qualifications to become a financial adviser.

Description.Html: Motor mechanics repair and service cars and vans.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It will help if you have enthusiasm for the motor industry and repairing cars. A knowledge of different makes and models can also be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working and training as a mechanic from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior technician, workshop supervisor or garage manager.

You could work as a breakdown engineer or MOT tester, or specialise in a particular area like motorsport engineering.

You could also work on electric and hybrid cars or specialise in tuning and modifying vehicles for higher performance.

You could also set up your own business.

Description.Html: Motor vehicle breakdown engineers help people whose vehicles have broken down.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about how to become a breakdown engineer from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become a supervisor or manager, or move into training.

Description.Html: Motor vehicle fitters repair and replace worn or damaged tyres, exhausts, batteries and parts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about careers in the motor industry from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into workshop supervision and management jobs, or related areas, like breakdown and recovery, service centre advice or general vehicle mechanics.

Description.Html: Motor vehicle parts persons supply individuals, dealerships and garages with spare parts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about working in the motor industry from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to a supervisor or service adviser job, or move into the service and repair.

You may be able to move into self-employment as a parts supplier.

Description.Html: Motorcycle mechanics service and repair motorbikes, scooters and quad bikes.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of the Motor Industry for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a motorcycle mechanic from Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a motorcycle diagnostic technician, workshop manager or train for a career as a motorcycle MOT examiner.

You could also start your own sales and repair business or specialise in customised bike building.

Description.Html: Motorsport engineers design, build and test racing cars and bikes.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Attending motorsport shows is a good way to meet employers, ask questions and to find out exactly which skills and experience they're looking for.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in motorsport from the Motorsport Industry Association and Your Future in Automotive.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular engineering field, like engine transmission or electronics.

You could also progress to test or workshop manager, chief engineer, technical coordinator or technical manager.

You could also work towards incorporated or chartered engineer status by applying to the Engineering Council.

Description.Html: MPs represent people's concerns and interests in the House of Commons.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a good understanding of local and national issues, and be up to date with current affairs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about becoming an MP from UK Parliament.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
General elections are held every 5 years, so it can take a long time to be elected MP.

With experience, you may get the opportunity to take on extra responsibilities like chairing committees and moving into more senior positions like party whip or even party leader.

If your political party is in power, you could go from junior minister to minister and then cabinet minister. If your party is in opposition, you could be a spokesperson on certain issues or have responsibilities in a shadow cabinet.

Description.Html: Museum assistants take care of customers and security in museums and galleries.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Museums Association for your professional development.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of security work could be useful for some jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice on working in museums from the Museums Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and relevant qualifications, you could become a programmes assistant, volunteer co-ordinator or assistant curator.

You could also become a learning assistant or education officer.

Description.Html: Museum curators manage collections of objects of artistic, scientific, historical and general interest.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Museums Association for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a museum curator from the Museums Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could progress to senior curator.

Description.Html: Music promotions managers publicise recording artists or live music events.

HtbCareerTips.Html: A knowledge of basic accounts and contract law could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice about working as a music promoter and promoting yourself through Musicians' Union.

You can also find information on working in the creative industries from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move to a larger company or you could specialise in an area like legal advice.

You could work freelance, start up your own promotions company or become an artists' agent or manager.

Description.Html: Music teachers give music lessons to people of all ages and abilities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can search for jobs in schools through the Teaching Vacancies service.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a music teacher from:Get Into Teaching; Incorporated Society of Musicians; Musicians' Union

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As a qualified and experienced music teacher in a school, you could become head of the music department.

You could also become an advisory teacher, or inspector employed by a local education authority or independent agency.

Description.Html: Music therapists use music and sound to help improve people's emotional well-being, relieve stress and build confidence.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the British Association for Music Therapy, for professional recognition, career development and to make contact with other therapists.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You could try an introductory course in music therapy to get an idea of what this work involves. Some universities and music colleges offer these courses, as well as the British Association for Music Therapy.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers and training in music therapy from the British Association for Music Therapy and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become self-employed and build up your own practice, or move into teaching.

You could also become a senior music therapist and manage a team of therapists or music therapy unit.

Description.Html: Musical instrument makers and repairers create new musical instruments or repair ones that have been damaged.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Craft skills are often more important than qualifications to get into this career. A background in woodworking or music technology may help.

You may also find it useful if you can play a musical instrument.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find details about training courses through The National Association of Musical Instrument Repairers.

You can get more information on working in crafts and creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
If you work for a larger manufacturer, you may be able to progress to supervisor or manager level.

You could move into product development, buying or sales work.

Description.Html: Nail technicians repair, paint and decorate clients' nails.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Working part time in a nail bar or beauty salon will help you learn about different treatments and how to look after customers in a more relaxed environment.

If you have the right skills, you could set up your own business. This could be a mobile service or a contract to go into leisure facilities like gyms, hotels and spas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a nail technician from the Hair and Beauty Industry Authority.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could manage a salon or start your own business.

You could work with photographers, fashion designers or TV companies, preparing nails for photo shoots or fashion shows.

With further training you could move into teaching nail art.

Description.Html: Nannies work in private homes caring for their employer's babies and young children.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details on working in childcare from the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years and on the early years career progression map.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With qualifications and experience, you could move into childminding or nursery work.

With further training, you could become a children's nurse or early years teacher.

Description.Html: Nanotechnologists design and build devices and materials on a tiny scale.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in nanotechnology through Nanowerk.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could work your way up to a management role.

You could also move into a teaching or lecturing role.

Description.Html: Naturopaths believe in improving their clients' health through natural therapies and education about lifestyle, diet and exercise.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the General Council and Register of Naturopaths and Association of Naturopathic Practitioners, for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a naturopath from the General Naturopathic Council and General Council and Register of Naturopaths.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into teaching or research.

Description.Html: Naval architects design, construct, refit and repair marine vessels and offshore structures.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Royal Institution of Naval Architects for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a naval architect from:Royal Institution of Naval Architects; Institute of Marine Engineering, Science and Technology; British Marine

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior positions. You could become a consultant, providing technical and commercial guidance, support and project management for research, design, construction, refits or conversions.

You could also move into other areas like procurement, sales and marketing

Description.Html: Neighbourhood wardens work in local communities to reduce anti-social behaviour.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a neighbourhood warden from your local council.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device
