CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could become an assistant head warden, senior warden, or warden coordinator.

Description.Html: Network engineers design, implement and maintain the way data is transferred across digital and telecommunications networks.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience in related areas like IT support or computer service and repair could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in networking from Tech Future Careers and The Chartered Institute for IT.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress into network management or you could move into other areas of IT like project management, information security or consultancy.

Description.Html: Network managers supervise the design, installation and running of IT, data and telephony systems in an organisation.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about computing careers and training through The Chartered Institute for IT and Tech Future Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll need to keep your skills up to date, for example in mobile and 'cloud' technologies. You can do this through professional development training and industry certifications.

You can move into project and information management, service planning and delivery, information security, business analysis or freelance consultancy.

Description.Html: Newspaper journalists investigate and write up stories for local, regional and national newspapers.

HtbBodies.Html: As a journalism student you can apply for student membership of the National Union of Journalists.

HtbCareerTips.Html: There are a number of bursaries available to eligible journalism students.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in journalism from the National Union of Journalists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a chief reporter or a specialist writer, covering areas like politics, business or particular regions of the country. You could move to a national newspaper or work as a critic.

You could move into other areas such as magazine, broadcast or online journalism. Or you could work in a press office or public relations.

Description.Html: Newspaper and magazine editors manage the style and content of printed publications.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations like the Society of Editors and Professional Publishers Association for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a newspaper and magazine editor from:National Council for the Training of Journalists

You can find out about other editorial and media careers from:Discover Creative Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience as a local newspaper editor you could move on to regional and then national publications.

You could become editor-in-chief of a group of newspapers, or magazine publishers.

Description.Html: Non-destructive testing (NDT) technicians test materials and components used in buildings, structures and machinery.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about this career through The British Institute of Non-Destructive Testing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior non-destructive technician, or specialise in a particular form of testing.

You could move into quality assurance, purchasing, technical sales, management, or research and development.

Description.Html: Nuclear engineers are responsible for the safe running of nuclear power stations.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may need to relocate for work, as many power stations are in remote areas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find details about careers in the the nuclear industry through Cogent.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into research, or university teaching. You could also work freelance.

Description.Html: Nuclear technicians maintain equipment and monitor radiation levels in nuclear power stations.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can find employers on the Nuclear Industry Association jobs map.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can learn more about working as a nuclear technician from Nuclear Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a maintenance shift supervisor, radiation safety adviser or nuclear engineer.

You could also use your skills to move into other engineering or power industries, or work in hospitals, maintaining radiotherapy and medical imaging equipment.

Description.Html: Nurses care for adults who are sick, injured or have physical disabilities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about how to become a nurse from the Royal College of Nursing and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular field such as intensive care or operating theatre work, or become a nursing sister, ward manager or team leader.

You could train as a midwife, neonatal nurse, health visitor, or district or practice nurse. You could also move into management, as a matron or director of nursing.

With a postgraduate qualification, you could become an advanced nurse practitioner or clinical nurse specialist, then a nurse consultant. There are opportunities to go into teaching and research.

You could also become self-employed or work overseas.

You can find out more about career progression from the Royal College of Nursing.

Description.Html: Nursery managers run early years childcare centres, providing day care for babies and young children from birth to 5 years.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can get more advice about careers in early years education and training from the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years and the National Day Nurseries Association

You can also find out more about working in childcare through the early years career progression map.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become an area manager and look after the work of a number of nurseries. You might also think about setting up your own private nursery. Ofsted has information on how to do this.

You could become a trainer or training assessor for people studying for childcare qualifications. You could also move into nursery inspection.

Taking a higher education qualification in early years or child development could help you move into teaching, children's nursing or social work.

Description.Html: Nursery workers help babies and children up to 5 years old to develop and learn in a safe and supportive setting.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You'll find advice on careers and courses in childcare from the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years and the National Day Nurseries Association.

You can also get more information on this career from the early years career progression map.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
As an experienced nursery worker you could specialise in working with children who have difficulties with learning, physical disabilities, or need support with their mental health.

You could take a Level 3 Early Years Educator qualification to progress to room leader, senior nursery worker or centre manager.

You could also study towards a higher education qualification in early years or child development. You could then move into management or early years teaching.

Description.Html: Nursing associates care for sick people of all ages in hospital and in the community, working closely with registered nurses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a nursing associate from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You can train to become a registered nurse by completing a shortened nursing degree or a nursing degree apprenticeship.

Description.Html: Nutritional therapists help people by giving advice on diet and nutrition.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Your prospects will be greatest as a self-employed therapist. To be successful you need to build up and maintain a sound reputation and client base which may mean working long hours at first.

Networking and training in other therapies may help to increase the number of clients that you see.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more about careers in nutritional therapy from the British Association for Nutrition and Lifestyle Medicine and the Naturopathic Nutrition Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could move into teaching or research.

Description.Html: Nutritionists share scientific food knowledge and advice about the effects of diet and nutrition on health and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can register with the Association for Nutrition to join the UK Voluntary Register of Nutritionists for professional recognition.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in nutrition from the Association for Nutrition and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in sports nutrition by taking a relevant postgraduate degree.

With experience, you could progress into management and policy development.

Description.Html: Occupational health nurses care for the health and wellbeing of people at work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about occupational health nursing from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into a management position, leading a team of occupational health staff or running an occupational health centre.

You could become a self-employed occupational health consultant, work for a private company or take extra qualifications and go into nurse training.

Description.Html: Occupational therapists help people overcome difficulties caused by physical or mental illness, disability, accidents or ageing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers and training in occupational therapy from the Royal College of Occupational Therapists and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could progress to senior clinician or head of occupational therapy services in the NHS. You may also be able to move into general health or social services management.

You could also go into private practice, education or research.

Description.Html: Occupational therapy support workers work with occupational therapists to help sick, injured or old people to be as independent as possible.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an occupational therapy support worker from the Royal College of Occupational Therapists and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team leader and supervise other occupational therapy support workers.

You could also train as an assistant practitioner and study for a foundation degree. You could then go on to train as an occupational therapist.

Description.Html: Oceanographers study the seas and oceans.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an oceanographer from the Society for Underwater Technology and the National Oceanography Centre.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could further your career by taking courses through the Marine Technology Education Consortium, or by networking at events run by the Society for Underwater Technology or the Challenger Society for Marine Science.

You could take a PhD through an initiative like the Southampton Partnership for Innovative Training of Future Investigators Researching the Environment (SPITFIRE).

Description.Html: Office managers oversee the day-to-day running of an office or department.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Administrative Management for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an office manager from the Institute of Administrative Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could take on more responsibility for managing projects, or provide cover for senior management duties.

Other career options include moving into buying and procurement, financial management, business development and operations management.

Description.Html: Offshore drilling workers drill for undersea oil and gas on offshore rigs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the offshore oil and gas industry from MyOilandGasCareer.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work for operating companies with their own exploration and production licences, or for drilling and maintenance contracting companies.

With experience, you could be promoted from driller to toolpusher or rig manager.

Description.Html: Ofsted inspectors visit, inspect and report on the quality of places of education and learning, and children's social care services.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more on how to become an inspector from Ofsted.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You’ll be recruited and trained by Ofsted.

With experience as an HMI - Her Majesty's Inspector, you could become a senior HMI or regional director. Regulatory inspectors may also become regulatory inspection managers or HMIs.

You could use your knowledge and experience to move into a senior role within your own area of work.

Description.Html: Oil and gas operations managers plan and co-ordinate onshore and offshore exploration and production.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an oil and gas operations manager from My Oil and Gas Career.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become an operations director or work independently as an oil and gas consultant, travelling all over the world.

Description.Html: Online tutors support students who are studying courses over the internet.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training to teach online from the Education & Training Foundation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could move into other areas of online education, like course development, management, private tuition or consultancy.

Description.Html: Operating department practitioners (ODPs) provide skilled care and support to patients at all stages of an operation.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: Health Careers has further details about this career and training options.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may be able to progress to team leader or senior ODP and manage an operating theatre unit.

You could also move into education, training and research.

Some ODPs take further training approved by the Royal College of Surgeons to work as surgical care practitioners. This would give you the skills to complete some surgical procedures, under the supervision of a consultant surgeon.

Description.Html: Operational researchers analyse how organisations can improve the way they work.

HtbBodies.Html: Joining a professional body like The Operational Research Society may improve your career prospects.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in operational research from The Operational Research Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a project or team leader, then manager of an operational research department.

You could also become self-employed as a management consultant.

Description.Html: Optometrists test vision, identify eye health problems, prescribe glasses and fit contact lenses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in optometry from:The College of Optometrists; General Optical Council; Health Careers

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in an area like paediatrics (working with children), contact lenses, sports vision or low vision.

You could study for an MSc in optometry or train further in contact lens practice, therapeutics (prescribing drugs for certain eye problems) or specific conditions like diabetes and glaucoma.

Description.Html: Order pickers select the products for delivery that customers have chosen to buy online.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it useful for some jobs if you've done forklift truck training.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a shift supervisor then move into section or warehouse management.

You could also become a delivery driver if you work for a supermarket.

Description.Html: Ornithologists study the behaviour, ecology, classification and conservation of birds and their habitats.

HtbBodies.Html: You can register with the British Ornithologists' Union, which has study resources for students and professionals, and information about help with course funding.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a British Trust for Ornithology ringing permit and experience as a birdwatcher to become a bird warden.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an ornithologist from the British Ornithologists' Union.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you might become a supervisor.

Description.Html: Orthoptists work with a team of specialists to diagnose and treat eye problems.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British and Irish Orthoptic Society, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts. Student membership is free of charge and runs until you graduate.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in this area from the British and Irish Orthoptic Society and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a specialist orthoptist, working with people affected by stroke, or with children.

You could become a head or consultant orthoptist, and manage a team or department.

You could also take further qualifications and move into research or teaching, or work in private practice and set up your own clinic.

Description.Html: Osteopaths move, stretch and massage their clients' muscles and joints with the aim of improving their health and wellbeing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming an osteopath from the General Osteopathic Council and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could set up your your own osteopathy practice.

You could also take further training and move into an academic career teaching osteopathy students.

You could also move into osteopathic research.

Description.Html: Outdoor activities instructors lead trips and teach skills in activities like hill walking, climbing, canoeing, skiing and snowboarding.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Institute of Outdoor Learning, for professional development, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: The Institute for Outdoor Learning has more information on becoming an outdoor activities instructor.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work on contract, or do freelance work.

With experience, you could progress to centre management, or set up your own activity centre.

Description.Html: Packaging technologists design and develop packaging for different products.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more on careers in packaging technology and design from The Packaging Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into areas like marketing and sales, development management or artwork design.

You could go freelance as a packaging consultant.

Description.Html: Packers work in factories and warehouses, putting products into containers like boxes and crates for delivery.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could become a supervisor or shift leader. With training, you could work in quality control or move into delivery work.

Description.Html: Paediatricians diagnose and treat health conditions that affect babies, children and young people.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health and the British Medical Association for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Check if your university has a paediatric society and get involved. The societies are a good way to hear about paediatric events, talks and training in your medical school.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in paediatrics from the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can apply for senior consultant roles, once you're on the General Medical Council Specialist Register.

You may go on to lead a team, manage a department or become medical director for an NHS Trust.

You could also move into teaching and training students, trainee doctors and other healthcare professionals.

Description.Html: Paint sprayers apply coatings and protective finishes to cars, vans, motorbikes and other vehicles.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in paint spraying in the motor industry through Autocity.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Your employer may offer you the chance to work towards IMI Accreditation. This allows you to move up to paint technician and senior paint technician roles.

You could also become a shift supervisor, quality control inspector or workshop manager.

You may be able to set up your own paint spraying business or specialise in car customisation.

Description.Html: Painters and decorators prepare and apply paint, wallpaper and finishes to different surfaces.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the Painting and Decorating Association for professional development and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out about careers in painting and decorating from Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a team supervisor or move into related areas like estimating, contract management, interior or set design, or apprentice training.

You could also work in heritage conservation, or set up your own business.

Description.Html: Palaeontologists study the fossils of plants and animals.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may find it helpful if you can speak a second language because you'll often be working with colleagues from around the world.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on palaeontology training through The Palaeontological Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work as a geological surveyor, a consultant in mining and mineral exploration, or the oil and gas industry.

You could move into university teaching and research.

The skills you gain are also valued in the scientific media, TV and the financial sector.

Description.Html: Palliative care assistants provide specialist end of life care and support to patients and their families.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a palliative care assistant from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could become a senior healthcare assistant.

You could train as an assistant practitioner in chiropody or podiatry, occupational therapy, radiography or physiotherapy.

You could also train as a health professional like a nurse, midwife or physiotherapist.

Description.Html: Paper makers make products, including tissue and heavy board, from wood and recycled materials.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in the paper industry from the Confederation of Paper Industries.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With training and experience you could move into jobs in quality control or paper technology.

Other career options include supervisory management, technical sales or production plant management.

Description.Html: Paralegals carry out research, prepare legal documents and give legal advice to clients.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll find it useful to have some understanding of how the legal system works.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about paralegal careers from the Institute of Paralegals and the National Association of Licenced Paralegals.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With further study, you could qualify as a legal executive or solicitor.

Description.Html: Paramedics respond to emergency call-outs and give people life-saving medical help.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the College of Paramedics and get access to courses, conferences and workshops to keep your skills up to date, and to swap ideas with colleagues in the profession.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a paramedic from the College of Paramedics and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With around 3 years' experience, you could become:

  • a team leader
  • a specialist paramedic
  • an emergency care practitioner

You could also move into operations management, education and training or research, or train to work in other areas of healthcare, for example nursing.

Description.Html: Patent attorneys advise clients on how to apply for patents on new inventions, designs or processes.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It may help in some jobs if you can read French and German to a reasonable level, as clients often want advice about European patents, which can be prepared in English, French or German.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more details about working in intellectual property rights from The Chartered Institute of Patent Attorneys.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become an associate or partner in a private practice firm.

In industry, you could move into management or research and development. You could also choose to become a patent examiner with the UK Intellectual Property Office or European Patent Office.

You could become a European patent attorney and work internationally.

Description.Html: Pathologists work in hospitals and laboratories on different areas of prevention, diagnosis and treatment of disease.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about a career in pathology from the Royal College of Pathologists.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you may go on to lead a team or manage a department.

With experience and entry on the General Medical Council (GMC) Specialist Register, you could apply for senior (or consultant) roles.

You could also progress to teaching and training students, trainee doctors and other healthcare professionals.

TitlePart.Title: Patient advice and liaison service officer

Description.Html: Patient advice and liaison service (PALS) officers give support, advice and information about NHS services.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in healthcare from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience and possibly further study, you could progress to senior PALS officer or PALS service manager.

data.DisplayText: Patient advice and liaison service officer
data.Author: admin

Description.Html: Patient transport service controllers arrange transport to take frail or vulnerable people to and from medical appointments.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some understanding of medical terms and the ability to speak a community language could be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a patient transport service controller from Health Careers and your local ambulance trust.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to emergency medical dispatcher or become a control room supervisor, leading a team of controllers or running a fleet of vehicles.

You could also move into training.

Description.Html: Pattern cutters create pattern templates based on drawings from a fashion designer to make clothes.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join The Textile Institute for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: To get onto courses and find jobs, you'll need a portfolio of your work to show off your skills and creative ideas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to head pattern cutter or grader or, with further training, fashion designer or buyer.

Description.Html: Payroll administrators make sure employees get paid the right amount on the right date.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in payroll from The Chartered Institute of Payroll Professionals.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to payroll supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Payroll managers manage the payroll department within an organisation.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a good understanding of payroll legislation.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more advice about careers in payroll from The Chartered Institute of Payroll Professionals.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work in the finance department of larger companies or public sector organisations like local authorities or the NHS.

You could move into pensions management or do further training to qualify as an accountant.

You could also work for a payroll bureau that provides payroll services to other companies.

Description.Html: Physical education (PE) teachers work in schools and colleges, teaching sport and fitness to young people.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You can attend teacher training events before you apply to get advice about the profession, the different training routes and funding. You can attend events in person and online.

Learning to drive is useful, as you may be expected to drive a minibus to take teams of pupils to sports events.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about how to become a teacher from Get Into Teaching.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a specialist leader of education, supporting teachers in other schools. You could also become a curriculum leader, head of department, deputy head or headteacher.

You could use your experience to work in coaching or sports development.

Description.Html: Pensions administrators handle the day-to-day running of pension schemes and life insurance policies.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find more advice about working in pensions from Pension Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could further your career with a qualification in pensions administration or calculations.

With experience, you could become a team leader, supervisor or pensions manager. With further study, you could qualify as a financial adviser.

Description.Html: Pensions advisers help people to plan for financial security in retirement.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Pensions Management Institute for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a pensions adviser from Pension Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in a particular type of pension, become a pensions manager, or move into other types of financial advice.

You could also become a self-employed pensions consultant.

Description.Html: Personal assistants carry out support tasks for individuals and managers including administration, diary management and event planning.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working and training in business administration from the Institute of Administrative Management.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move to a larger company or work for a more senior manager.

You could also move into an executive assistant (EA) role with more responsibility.

Description.Html: Personal shoppers give advice to customers and suggest products that may suit their needs.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join an organisation like the Federation of Image Professionals International for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html: If you want to work as a personal shopper for clothing, you'll have a definite advantage if you've got skills in fashion or design. Many self-employed personal shoppers have this sort of background.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a personal shopper from the Federation of Image Professionals International.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a personal shopping manager, in charge of a team.

You could start your own business and work freelance for a number of shops.

Description.Html: Personal trainers work with clients to improve their health and fitness.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It's usual to have a certificate in first aid that includes cardio-pulmonary resuscitation (CPR).

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in exercise and fitness from the National Register of Personal Trainers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could take further instructor courses to learn new skills to offer clients, like yoga, pilates, nutrition or aerobics.

With further training, you could also work with people recovering from illness or who have medical conditions.

Description.Html: Pest control technicians identify and get rid of pests like rats, mice and cockroaches.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Pest Control Association and National Pest Technicians Association for professional development and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in pest control through the British Pest Control Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could be promoted to supervisor or manager.

You could also start your own business.

Description.Html: Pet shop assistants serve customers and look after animals in pet shops.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager.

Description.Html: Petrol station sales assistants sell fuel and other items to customers in garage forecourt shops.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could progress to shop supervisor then manager. Many petrol station are owned by supermarkets and you may have opportunities to work in the store.

Description.Html: Pharmacists provide expert advice on the use and supply of medicines and medical appliances.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on pharmacy careers and training from Health Careers and the Royal Pharmaceutical Society.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
There's a formal career structure in the NHS, so with experience you could progress to team manager or pharmacy consultant. You could also work in GPs' surgeries or health centres.

Promotion opportunities can be good if you're working for one of the larger pharmacy chains where you can apply for regional or national management positions.With experience, you could set up your own community pharmacy business.

After further training, you could go on to teach pharmacy students at university.

Another option is to move into related areas like scientific journalism or publishing.

To do research, you'll need a further postgraduate qualification in a subject like toxicology or pharmacology.

The Royal Pharmaceutical Society offers professional support services.

Description.Html: Pharmacologists study the effects of drugs and other chemical substances on cells, animals, humans and the environment.

HtbBodies.Html: You could join the British Pharmalogical Society for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a pharmacologist through the British Pharmacological Society and the Association of the British Pharmaceutical Industry.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisor or manager. You could also move into medical sales and marketing, drug registration, patent work or information science.

You could work in research and development with a postgraduate degree in pharmacology or a relevant PhD.

Description.Html: Pharmacy assistants serve customers and patients in chemists and hospital dispensaries.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a pharmacy assistant from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and a qualification like the Level 2 NVQ Certificate in Pharmacy Service Skills, you could become a senior pharmacy assistant.

With further training, you could become a pharmacy technician.

Description.Html: Pharmacy technicians prepare and supply medicines for prescriptions, under the supervision of a pharmacist.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers as a pharmacy technician from Health Careers and the Association of Pharmacy Technicians.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
In a hospital, you could move to:

  • a specialist role like clinical technician, working with healthcare professionals and patients on wards
  • a specialist area of work like oncology, paediatrics, or clinical trials
  • research and development

In a pharmacy, you could become a supervisor or manager.

You could also train as a pharmacist through a pharmacy foundation degree, which is a two-year, full-time course. When you finish this course, you can then apply for year two of an accredited MPharm degree.

In industry, you could move into more specialised areas of development and production, or move into sales or marketing.

Another option is to become a pharmacy assessor working with trainee pharmacy technicians.

Description.Html: Phlebotomists collect blood samples from patients, and send them off for analysis and testing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the National Association of Phlebotomists and Institute of Biomedical Science for professional recognition and training opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a phlebotomist from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could be a senior phlebotomist and have responsibility for more complex work. You could also become a team leader or manager.

Your skills and experience in phlebotomy could give you an advantage if you want to go into donor care and work with the NHS Blood and Transplant Service.

Description.Html: Photographers take and process pictures of people, places, products and events.

HtbBodies.Html:
The Association of Photographers offers membership for anyone with an interest in professional photography.

You can also apply to join the British Institute of Professional Photography.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You'll need a portfolio of your work to show your skills, interests and experience in photography. It'll also help you to get noticed if you post examples of your work online.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about becoming a photographer through the British Institute of Professional Photography.

You can get more details on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages confidently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
Many photographers are freelance and you could do a mix of contract work and following your own interests. You could extend your range into other areas of photography like product, property, aerial or corporate work. With training, you could also work as a press or police photographer.

If you do specialist qualifications, you could find jobs in medical photography or illustration.

You may decide to become self-employed and set up your own business.

Photography is very competitive, so you'll need creativity and technical skills to make money. You'll also need finance for equipment, a space to work in, and some business and admin skills.

You could increase your income by selling your images independently.

Description.Html: Photographic technicians help photographers and produce images from digital files.

HtbCareerTips.Html: For some digital imaging jobs, you'll need experience of desktop publishing packages like Photoshop, QuarkXpress, Illustrator or InDesign.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in photography from The Association of Photographers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could move into management.

You could also choose to start your own photographic business or open a franchise to run a mini-lab.

Description.Html: Physician associates support doctors to diagnose and manage patients in hospitals and GP surgeries.

HtbBodies.Html: At the end of your course you will sit a national exam and apply for physician associate membership of the Royal College of Physicians. This allows you to join the Physician Associate Managed Voluntary Register (PAMVR) which proves to employers that you are a fully qualified physician associate.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You can find vacancies on NHS Jobs and the Royal College of Physicians medical jobs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about training and working as a physician associate from the Royal College of Physicians and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: As an experienced physician associate you may be able to move into management, medical teaching or research. Many physician associates work in general practice or emergency care, though it could be possible to specialise in a specific clinical area like paediatric care or mental health.

Description.Html: Physicists study matter and try to work out why it behaves like it does.

HtbCareerTips.Html: You may have an advantage if you've got relevant work experience. You could get this through a work placement as part of your degree or during vacations, or a scheme like the Year in Industry programme.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in physics through the Institute of Physics.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could work in health or research institutes, defence or robotics, aerospace, computing and electronics, power generation or gas and oil,or government departments, like the Met Office.

You could use your scientific knowledge in other areas like education, scientific journalism and patent work.

With experience, you’ll take on more responsibility and manage the work of other scientists.

You could also move into a senior research role, or progress into consultancy work.

Description.Html: Physiotherapists work with patients to improve their range of movement, and promote health and wellbeing.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy for professional development and networking opportunities.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about physiotherapy careers from Health Careers and the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become self-employed and set up your own practice.

In the NHS, you could progress to senior physiotherapist or move into health service management. You could also specialise in an area like orthopaedics, sports therapy, occupational health, or working with older people or children.

You could also move into research or teaching.

Description.Html: Physiotherapy assistants help physiotherapists work with patients to restore or improve movement.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a physiotherapy assistant from the Chartered Society of Physiotherapy and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further qualifications, you could become a senior physiotherapy support worker, or assistant practitioner.

You could take an accredited degree to train as a physiotherapist.

Description.Html: Picture framers mount items like photographs, paintings and other artwork for display.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Gallery experience or skills in woodworking may be useful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: The Fine Art Trade Guild has more advice on how to get into picture framing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could start your own business or take a franchise.

Description.Html: Pilates teachers help clients change and improve their body strength and posture through breathing, stretching and conditioning exercises.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join organisations like the Pilates Teacher Association or the Pilates Foundation for professional development and training opportunities.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could find work in private health studios, commercial or council leisure centres to teach group classes. You could also find work as a private tutor, working in clients’ homes.

You could work with health professionals, like physiotherapists, to help athletes or dancers with rehabilitation following injury.

You could also specialise in antenatal Pilates (for pregnant women), Pilates for lower back pain, or Pilates for older adults.

Description.Html: Pipe fitters install industrial pipework, valves and pumps in factories, commercial premises and large buildings like power stations.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about pipe fitting from Engineering Construction Industry Training Board (ECITB) Careers and the Building and Engineering Services Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could be promoted to supervisor or become an engineering workshop manager. You could also work in welding inspection and quality control.

With further training, you may have opportunities to move into insulation work, or engineering design where you'll draw up pipework installation plans.

Description.Html: Planning and development surveyors assess, design and manage development projects in towns, cities and rural areas.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a planning and development surveyor from the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could be promoted to project or senior management roles, go into partnership in private practice, or become self-employed as a consultant.

You could also move into other areas of surveying or town planning.

Description.Html: Plasterers prepare walls and ceilings for decoration and finishing.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a plasterer from Go Construct and House Building Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to supervisory jobs or move into related areas like tiling, estimating and site management.

You could become self-employed and work as a sub-contractor.

Description.Html: Play therapists help children to make sense of difficult life experiences, or complex psychological issues through play.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It'll help when looking for work to make as many contacts as you can while you're training. Job vacancies are not always advertised.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more advice about careers in play therapy from the British Association of Play Therapists and Play Therapy UK.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and further training, you could supervise less experienced therapists. You might also provide a consultation service to professionals in the community.

You could move into training, lecturing or clinical supervision.

Description.Html: Playworkers support children and young people to create their own spaces and opportunities for play.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more details on working in childcare from the Professional Association for Childcare and Early Years.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training, you could work for a local authority as a playwork development officer, supervisor or become a manager, or move into a school as a teaching assistant.

You could also be self-employed and set up your own after-school club or childcare project.

Description.Html: Plumbers fit and service hot and cold water systems, heating systems and drainage networks.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Institute of Plumbing and Heating Engineering for professional development and industry news.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a plumber from the Chartered Institute of Plumbing and Heating Engineering and Go Construct.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You can develop your skills by taking further training in areas like heating, ventilation and air-conditioning, and renewable energy technologies like solar powered heating.

You can also join the Gas Safe Register or get certified with the Oil Firing Technical Association (OFTEC). These would show you're qualified to work on gas or oil-fired appliances.

You could go on to study for a higher national diploma or degree and become an engineer. This could lead to career options in building services engineering, estimating and contract management.

Description.Html: Podiatrists diagnose and treat foot and ankle problems, improving people's mobility and quality of life.

HtbBodies.Html: You may find it useful to join organisations for professional development and networking opportunities, like:The Institute of Chiropodists and Podiatrists; British Chiropody and Podiatry Association; College of Podiatry

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in this area from Careers in Podiatry.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could focus on a specialist area like surgery or orthotics, designing and fitting appliances like braces and in-shoe correction aids.

You could join a professional body to get access to training in areas like nail surgery, diabetes and wound care.

You could set up your own practice. Some people combine this with part-time working in the NHS.

You could study for a Master’s (MSc) or PhD and move into research or teaching.

Description.Html: Podiatry assistants provide general foot treatments and nail care under the supervision of a podiatrist.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a podiatry assistant from The Alliance of Private Sector Practitioners and Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could move up to an assistant practitioner post. You could then apply to train as a podiatrist.

If you're self-employed, you could set up your own business.

Description.Html: Police community support officers (PCSOs) work in a neighbourhood policing team dealing with minor offences and crime prevention.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Great value is placed on personal qualities and character, especially:

  • the ability to remain calm under pressure
  • tolerance and empathy combined with firmness

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about the role of police community support officer from the College of Policing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
There is no formal route from PCSO to police officer, but the training and experience you gain could help you if you want to move into this role.

You could also use your experience to mentor and train new PCSOs.

Description.Html: Police officers keep law and order, investigate crime, and support crime prevention.

HtbCareerTips.Html: If you're aged 13 to 18 you could become a police cadet.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about routes into policing from Joining the Police.

You'll need to contact your local police force to apply, as each force has its own recruitment rules.

You can find out more about careers in the police from the College of Policing.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You'll spend 2 years as a student officer before becoming a police constable. You can then decide whether you want to specialise in a particular type of policing, for example:

  • criminal investigation department (CID), anti-fraud or road traffic
  • drugs or firearms
  • counter-terrorism
  • air support or underwater search
  • dog-handling or mounted policing

With experience, you may be able to apply for promotion to sergeant, inspector or chief inspector.

In the CID you'll also have the title of detective added to your rank, for example detective sergeant or detective chief inspector.

Description.Html: Port operatives work with cargo, passengers and marine craft in ports and harbours.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in ports and harbours from Port Skills and Safety.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could be promoted to foreperson or supervisor, and then move on to become a superintendent or operations manager. You might also train to specialise in engineering to maintain the heavy machinery used in ports.

Description.Html: Portage home visitors provide help at home for pre-school children with learning difficulties, physical disabilities or other special needs.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a Portage home visitor from the National Portage Association.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could become a senior Portage worker with supervisory or management responsibilities.

You could also study to be an accredited Portage trainer or look for work in a special educational needs school.

Description.Html: Post Office customer service assistants help customers in post offices and at counters in shops.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Previous customer service experience in banks, offices or shops would be very helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working as a counter assistant from the Post Office.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience you could progress to a position in a larger branch, or become an assistant branch manager or branch manager.

Description.Html: Postmen and postwomen sort letters and packages for delivery to homes and businesses.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more on careers and training in postal work from Royal Mail.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could be promoted to higher grades like supervisor and manager. You could move into parcel deliveries, courier jobs or customer care and administration.

Description.Html: Practice nurses work in GP surgeries to assess, screen, treat and educate patients, and help doctors give medical care.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a practice nurse from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could specialise in health promotion, chronic disease management, diabetes or asthma care.

With experience and qualifications you could become a nurse practitioner, managing your own caseload of patients.

You could also move into management, teaching or research.

Description.Html: Pre-press operators work in the printing industry, getting artwork from a client and supplying the printing plates used on a press.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Some knowledge of desktop publishing software will be useful, like InDesign, Illustrator or QuarkXPress.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about careers in print from the British Printing Industries Federation.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could become a pre-press manager or move into print administration jobs like estimator or production controller.

Most employers in the pre-press industry will offer training, either through a local college or short courses offered by the British Printing Industries Federation.

TitlePart.Title: Primary care graduate mental health worker

Description.Html: Primary care graduate mental health workers give treatment and support to people with mental health problems.

HtbCareerTips.Html: Experience of working with people with mental health problems will be helpful.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in primary mental health care from Health Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could train as a high intensity therapist, working with people with complex mental health needs.

You could also lead a team or develop new mental health services.

data.DisplayText: Primary care graduate mental health worker
data.Author: admin

Description.Html: Primary school teachers are responsible for the educational, social and emotional development of children from age 5 to 11.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
You can do a subject knowledge enhancement course to improve your understanding of the subject you want to teach.

You can also attend teacher training events before you apply to get advice about the profession, the different training routes and funding. You can attend events in person and online.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can discover more about how to become a teacher from Get Into Teaching.

You can also search for jobs through the Teaching Vacancies service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
You could teach pupils with special educational needs or move into pastoral care.

With experience, you could become a specialist leader of education, supporting teachers in other schools.

You could be a curriculum leader, deputy head and headteacher, or move into private tuition.

There are also opportunities to teach overseas in international schools.

Description.Html: Prison governors manage prisons, remand centres and young offenders' institutions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about working in prisons from Her Majesty's Prison and Probation Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could work in a more secure prison or join HM Inspectorate of Prisons.

You could also work in the national headquarters of HMPPS.

Another option is to work within prison service colleges or training units around the UK.

Description.Html: Prison instructors teach prisoners new skills to help them find work after their release.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html:
You can find out more about teaching qualifications from FE Advice.

Find out more about the role from Her Majesty's Prison & Probation Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: You could become a senior or principal officer, or move into other areas of training or instructing.

Description.Html: Prison officers supervise inmates in prisons, remand centres and young offenders' institutions.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about how to become a prison officer from HM Prison & Probation Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to carry out basic tasks on a computer or hand-held device

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience and training you could move into specialist projects, like rehabilitation work with specific groups of prisoners and their families.

You could become a supervising officer, custodial manager, head of function, deputy governor or governor.

Description.Html: Private practice accountants help people and businesses manage their money effectively.

HtbBodies.Html: If you've qualified with the Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA), you can offer most accountancy services in private practice but you'll need to register as a 'member in practice' with CIMA.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more about becoming a private practice accountant from:Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales (ICAEW); Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA); Association of International Accountants (AIA); Chartered Institute of Management Accountants (CIMA)

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to have a thorough understanding of computer systems and applications

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could specialise in an area like auditing or forensic accounting, or become a manager in a practice. You could then move into a partnership or become a finance director.

You could also become self-employed or set up your own company.

Description.Html: Probation officers supervise people serving community and prison sentences and help them to stay away from crime.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Probation Institute for professional development opportunities.

HtbCareerTips.Html: It will help if you have some knowledge of how the criminal justice and rehabilitation systems work.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You'll find more on how to become a probation officer from HM Prison & Probation Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience you could become a senior probation officer.

With further training you could specialise in working with particular groups, like high-risk or sexual offenders.

Further promotion usually means moving into management and away from working with offenders. You could become an area manager.

Description.Html: Probation services officers (PSOs) supervise people serving community and prison sentences who are considered to be 'low-risk'.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can find out more information about careers, training and job vacancies in probation from HM Prison and Probation Service.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html: With experience, you could move into a supervisory role, or train as a probation officer.

Description.Html: Product designers create new products and improve existing ones.

HtbBodies.Html: You can join the Chartered Society of Designers for professional recognition, training opportunities and to make industry contacts.

HtbCareerTips.Html:
Entering design competitions and exhibitions can be a good way of getting yourself noticed by employers.

You'll need to show employers that you have creative skills, technical knowledge and the ability to work to a design brief. This will usually involve presenting a portfolio of your design work to them.

HtbFurtherInformation.Html: You can get more information on working in creative careers from Discover Creative Careers.

WitDigitalSkillsLevel.Html: to be able to use a computer and the main software packages competently

CareerPathAndProgression.Html:
With experience, you could progress to senior designer, then creative director.

You could also move into project management or design management.
